elements.title: Shareholder Rights Agreement and Corporate Governance Provisions

data.value: Under the bye-laws, shareholders and the Company waive any claim or right of action against any indemnitee for actions taken (except in cases of fraud or illegal profit), covering directors, officers, and employees.

The Board may purchase and maintain insurance for any indemnitee, including current or former directors, officers or employees, against liabilities incurred in the execution or discharge of their duties.

The Memorandum of Association can be amended with a majority vote of outstanding common shares, while the bye-laws require approval of at least 75% of votes cast by issued and outstanding common shares.
On June 16, 2017, the Board declared a dividend of one preferred share purchase right for each outstanding common share and adopted a rights plan to guard against coercive or unfair takeover tactics.

The Rights Agreement imposes penalties on any person or group acquiring 15% or more of common shares without Board approval. Existing beneficial ownership is grandfathered, but any increase of 1% or more post-announcement triggers the rights, resulting in potential dilution.
The Rights may have anti-takeover effects but will not interfere with a merger or other business combination approved by the Board.

elements.title: Rights Agreement Provisions & Trigger Events

data.value: If an Acquiring Person obtains 15%+ of common shares, and one of the following occurs: (i) the Company merges into another entity; (ii) an acquiring entity merges into the Company; or (iii) the Company sells/transfers 50%+ of its assets, cash flow, or earning power.
Upon a trigger event, each valid Right entitles the holder to purchase common shares at an Exercise Price, where the market value is twice the Exercise Price.
Shares held by affiliates, associates, and notional common shares via derivatives are deemed beneficially owned by the Acquiring Person.
The Board may redeem all Rights at $0.01 per Right before any person or group becomes an Acquiring Person. Adjustments apply for stock dividend or split.

Post trigger, before an Acquiring Person owns 50%+ of shares, the Board may extinguish Rights by exchanging one common share (or equivalent security) for each Right, with potential cash or other securities alternative.
Rights expire on the earlier of June 16, 2027, or upon redemption/exchange of the Rights.
The Board may adjust the purchase price and the number of Preferred Shares and Rights to prevent dilution from stock dividends, splits, or reclassifications.

Terms of the Rights can be amended without holders' consent on or before the Distribution Date, and later with limited exceptions that do not adversely affect Rights holders (excluding Acquiring Persons or their affiliates).
Distribution of Rights should not be taxable for federal income tax purposes, though taxable income may be recognized upon exercisability or redemption.
